content:
Hi. I've seen some people using Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) to write Rust codes. They are Windows users but their compiler host is x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu. One of them was wondering which answer he should choose for "What platform(s) do you develop on?": Windows, Linux, or both?

I guess we might want to add "Windows (WSL)" to the platform list in addition to "Windows"?
that's a good point
and yet I think if we're going to open the survey, I'm reluctant to make the change :) I guess if somebody (or a few people) wanted to make it across all languages I'd in be favor
it seems like something you can do without knowing the languages in questiojn :)
does a translator have access to the docs for all languages? maybe I will check with @tanakakz and @CYBAI to see if they would do me a favor. (we are a kind of knowing each other)
it's almost midnight in our time zones, so I will talk to them in tomorrow morning.
@Tatsuya Kawano I think I gave everyone access to the folder and hence all docs
I'll double check

@Tatsuya Kawano yes, we can access documentation in all languages. (I actually confirmed it now)
and the scope of this change is language-independent, so I think I can do it all at once soon.

@Tatsuya Kawano I'm also happy to help if needed :eyes: but I'm a bit busy during daytime, maybe I can help for now.
I think basically need to add "Window (WSL)" to question 7, is that correct?
@tanakakz @CYBAI thanks a lot for your helps. I do not have the question number, but it should read "What platform(s) do you develop on?" in English. and yes, I want to add "Windows (WSL)" to it.
ok, I see!
@tanakakz how about letting me adding it from [pl] to English version and others by you?
btw, the Simplified Chinese version is separately holded on qq.com (IIRC) and translated by @Xidorn Quan ; I think we will need his help to update the Simplified Chinese one.
@Tatsuya Kawano I think it might be good to add Windows (WSL) to the question of "What platforms are you targeting?" as well?

it might be good to add WIndows (WSL) to the question of "What platforms are you targeting?"

no, I don't think so. people use WSL to develop, but I think nobody is targeting WSL as WSL is not intended for production use. so please just leave it.
ah, okay, I see!

btw, the Simplified Chinese version is separately holded on qq.com (IIRC) ...

okay. thank you for letting me know. yeah, we do not have access to Google stuff if we are in China mainland (where I live). I will try to follow up.
okay, I just updated most of them
thank you!

Looks like the [ko] has their own translation for Windows though, I only added Windows (WSL) without translation to the question. and [hi] translated the questions which I'm afraid I will add it to a wrong section.

Maybe we need to ask Korean translator's help to confirm if they want to translate Windows (WSL) and Hindi translator's help to add Windows (WSL) to the question :bow:
@CYBAI Okay, I added the Windows (WSL) choice to section 7 of the [pl] and [jp] doc in line with the changes in the English version.
@tanakakz thank you!
@CYBAI @tanakakz again, thank you guys!
Thanks y'all!
@CYBAI to confirm, just one question in Rust Platform section get a new option "Windows (WSL)" under "Windows", right?

@Xidorn Quan

just one question in Rust Platform section get a new option "Windows (WSL)" under "Windows", right?

yes. that is correct.
cool. it has been update now.
@Tatsuya Kawano thanks for the reply :D and @Xidorn Quan thanks for the update!
